title: attempting double-free using the mruby compiler `mrbc`
vulnerability_information:
I cloned the mruby git 4 days ago, started fuzzing with American Fuzzy Lop. This is the 1st crash. 

./mrbc test000
```
codegen error:test000:1: too complex expression
=================================================================
==12142==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: attempting double-free on 0x60200000d750 in thread T0:
    #0 0x7f2fd1fd0527 in __interceptor_free (/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libasan.so.1+0x54527)
    #1 0x425788 in mrb_default_allocf /root/mruby/src/state.c:56

    #7 0x4061c9 (/root/mruby/bin/mrbc+0x4061c9)
```

activities.message:
Thank you for reporting this bug! This is an automated response to let you know that we've received your issue, and we'll process it as soon as possible.

Due to the holiday period and the large volume of reports we have received, it may take us up to three weeks to respond. Thank you for your patience!
Thank you for your report. We've reproduced the issue, and opened an issue upstream: https://github.com/mruby/mruby/issues/3378

Thanks again for your report. This issue has been resolved upstream in https://github.com/mruby/mruby/commit/f0f095bc135c4d2e6f6d54d6b5683db77708369b

Our next round of bounty decisions will take place within two weeks, so we'll be in touch with you again soon.
Thanks for helping improve the security of Mruby and Shopify Scripts!
My pleasure Andrew. Thank you for the bounty!
